title: Delicious fresh food
text:
Booked an outdoor table for lunch, initially in the 'marque', but we chose to sit outside on one of the picnic tables.

Excellent prompt service from a delightful friendly waitress.

Quite a limited menu, but this wasn't a big deal, particularly due to the circumstances.

I had the Thai squid salad, which was perfection. So delicious and tasty. My husband had a burger with bacon and cheese, this too was excellent.

Can't wait to return.

title: Good views but a little busy
text:
Stunning views. Unusually popular with people converging at the beacon from all directions.

Included the beacon on a long Exmoor hike. Was planning a mountain bike route but the ground was too icy and snowy.

title: Beautifully rugid
text:
Stunning clapper bridge across the River Barle in the Exmoor National Park, Somerset, England.

Great place for a picnic, visit to the pub or an ice-cream ) coffee stop during a hike.

Can get a bit busy at weekends.

title: Great cycle/hiking stop off
text:
Stopped by here during a four hour walk, detouring slightly to hit the village of Withypool.

Good selection of drinks, we didn't eat.

Service a little slow.

title: Great setting, excellent service
text:
What a pleasure to return here after pubs have been closed for so long. Obviously we ate outside as the inside is closed due to Covid restrictions.

Service was very friendly and prompt.

Food is very much pub grub. Starter was prawn cocktails which was passable. Not a lot of flavour, particularly the frozen prawns.

The steak was fair.

title: Delicious homemade food
text:
Managed a lunchtime visit hours before lockdown.

Sat in a lovely cosy little room at the far end of the pub. Excellent service.

Good menu. I had the fishcake starter which was Fabulous, and my husband had the bacon brioche, which he thoroughly enjoyed.

Will be coming back as soon as possible.

title: Superb food
text:
Are outside in the tent, do that we could meet with others iutsyour household.

Great extensive menu. Amazing delicious food, served piping hot, inspite of cold temperature outside.

Dress appropriately in the tent, as it was prry old, even though there were large heaters.

title: Great location
text:
Just popped in for a quick coffee stop with the family after s meeting. Very good central location.

Great coffee and tea, good Covid measures. Felt very safe.

Prompt and friendly service.
Recommended.

title: Superb meal
text:
Had a bit of a wait whilst are table was been thoroughly cleansed. Waited in one of the tented heated areas. As the wait was longer than expected, we were kindly given complimentary glasses of mulled wine.

All our meals were beautifully presented, using local quality ingredients. My cheese souffle starter was delicious. The wild sea bass with Bombay potato, chargrilled fennel,
cauliflower & saffron purée, greens, squid & cheese croquette, Thai-spiced
mussel & coconut broth was simply out of this world, and very generous portion.

Covid measures strictly in place, and we felt very safe.

Highly highly recommended.

title: Idyllic
text:
Beautiful secluded canal with tow path running beside it for its 11 mile length.

Super for walkers, runners, cyclists (dismount please when approaching bridges to avoid cycling into walkers!).

Great birdlife, including sighting kingfishers on several occasions just before dusk.

Pubs in route too, many benches, and great views.

title: Superb
text:
Lovely friendly, attentive staff, who couldn't do more to help us on this sad occasion of my mother's wake.

Superb food, homemade quiches, sausage rolls, and delicious sandwiches.

Bar staff were lovely.

Hotel room was very good, and the duvet and bed linen high quality and luxurious.

Thank you.

title: Faultless
text:
Had a superb meal dinner here. Really friendly and attentive staff.

Every dish was beautifully presented and absolutely delicious.

Highly recommended.

title: Lovely
text:
First outing at the end of lockdown, and we were all absolutely delighted at the friendly and safe environment.

Excellent food, and the little palaces outside looked so cute.

title: A marvelous little find
text:
Stopped by for lunch at this delightful little restaurant. What a gem of a place.

Lots of locals, off the tourist trail. Good prices, a good selection of dishes.

The chef's are at work in the open kitchen behind the bar, everything freshly cooked and really delicious.

Cheese saganaki was one of the best we've had. The grilled vegetables amazing.

Highly recommended.

title: Disappointing
text:
We were at the end of a four day visit to Athens, and were running out of things to do. This site was on our combination ticket, so we wandered over there during our last day's walking exploration.

Don't hold your breath! Not very much to see, except for the water cystern and accompanying information on Athens's water supply, was quite informative. The gardens themselves were extremely underwhelming.

title: Great drink stopover
text:
On a day's walking exploration of Athens, we needed a break and rest for a bit. On walking past Athens Cathedral, located on a quiet square, we spotted this attractive looking cafe. Unusually, the drinks prices were extremely reasonable, and not hiked up for the tourists. Having said that, the clientele were mainly local.

Nice glass of wine, a large draft beer & complimentary nibbles were 6.50 EUR

title: Huge
text:
Perhaps worth visiting twice as there is s lot to see. Either that or choose what really interested you.

The statues are excellent, depicting the different artistic styles throughout the centuries in ancient Greece.

The treasures from Ancient Micyene were my highlight.

Pottery collection vast.

title: Lovely roof terrace
text:
Stayed here for several nights and the place grew on me.

My first impressions were not positive as the area where the hotel is located is not great - an unattractive busy main road. However the location was only about a 10 - 15 minute walk to the main sites , restaurants etc. The room rate was extremely reasonable.

Our "deluxe" room was hardly deluxe - plain nondescript room, nothing in the room or on the walls to make it look attractive or deluxe. Tiny balcony with a missing wooden slat (health and safety?!) which wasn't big enough to sit out on.

Nice bathroom with a separate bath with shower and a shower cubicle which also contained the loo!! Not great when the floor is wet after a shower!

Toiletries provided, but no cups or water glasses. A refrigerator in the room, but this was the only hotel in Greece that did not provide any complimentary bottled water.

On a more positive note, the staff were very friendly and helpful.

The buffet breakfast in the very well appointed basement dining room was excellent and Covid measures were in place. The waitress were excellent.

The rooftop terrace bar and restaurant had a fabulous view of the city and the Acropolis. However the house wine at 8 Euros a glass was absolutely outrageous.

Overall a good choice of accommodation for the price, and price reflected the location.

title: Stunning
text:
One of the very best ancient temples in Athens, and still with its roof!

No one around, so had the place to ourselves. Us and the beautiful cockatoos.

title: Stunning
text:
Visited this beautiful amphitheater whilst exploring the Acropolis.

Stunning location, looking down on the theatre from the Parthenon.

We couldn't go inside unfortunately.

title: Great view from roof terrace
text:
Not sure why this restaurant rates so highly in TripAdvisor, as I thought the food was quite average.

Small cozy roof terrace, amazing views of the Acropolis.

Our starters were excellent. However the main courses were very average and nothing special.

For appetizers were had cheese balls and baked eggplant with feta, both were excellent.

I had grilled chicken kebab with salad - s bit overcooked and dry. My husband's burgers were very tasty.

Service was excellent and very friendly.

title: Stunning and Covid quiet
text:
Normally this site would be packed, even in October. However, due to Covid travel restrictions, a fraction of the usual amount of tourists are around.

Covid safety measures were in place and impressive.

Very hot, even this time of year. Go early to avoid heat of the day.

A lot to see, and don't be put off my the crane permanently installed inside the Parthenon - an ongoing restoration project, which is very well documented in the informative noticeboards.

A highlight my Athens visit.

title: Worth a quick visit
text: If you've bought an Athens pass, it's definitely worth a visit. Very impressive columns, vast. Not a lot else to see.

title: Beautiful
text: Don't miss this impressive site, part of which has been heavily restored, thanks to the Rockefeller's.

title: Impressive
text:
Definitely worth a visit, it won't take you long.

Stunning architecture, and pretty atmospheric.

Beautiful marble everywhere.

title: Favourite area in Athens
text:
If you have time, do have a meander along the twisting streets of Plaka. Lovely buildings, interspersed with ancient ruins. Many cafés, bars and restaurants en route.

Shame about the huge amount of graffiti.

title: Awesome
text:
Why come to Athens for the first time unless you want to visit the Acropolis?!

We thoroughly enjoyed our half day visit of this expansive site. During Covid, it's very quiet.

Very hot, even in October. Wear decent shoes.

Recommended visiting the Acropolis Museum as well, and watch the excellent film there on the top floor.

title: Friendliest service ever
text:
We tried to get s table the previous night, but the restaurant was full, so booked a table for the following evening.

Nice quiet untouristy street. Superb service.

Limited menu, but what we had was very very good.

Are starters were fantastic. Feta in full with honey was to die for

Grilled shrimp were fresh and delicious. Some vegetables or rice to accompany it would have made the dish perfect.

Good house winem

title: Great basic local food
text:
Are here as it was buzzing with locals. We were tired, hungry, just arrived in town, and the restaurant we planned to eat at was full!

Service was excellent, almost too quick. Perhaps I could recommend that if you want starters and a main, order the main once you've eaten you starter. Our main arrived just as our starters came.

All our dishes were really excellent. The toasted pitta bread was amazing. As were the roasted tomatoes.

My kebabs were very tasty, and I ordered yoghurt on the side, which really added to the meal.

A very short menu, but everything cooked to order, fresh and delicious.

title: Superb
text:
Fabulous restaurant with a beautiful view of the valley below.

Service was incredibly swift and friendly.

The house white wine was excellent, the red not to my liking though.

Our starters were really delicious, intense flavours and nicely presented.

My lamb was very good.

Highly recommended.

title: Very informative
text:
An excellent museum describing the history of the ancient Olympic games.

Very good displays, very informative.

title: Fascinating
text:
Spent several hours wandering around this amazingly interesting ancient archaeological site.

Hardly anyone else around, which really added to the atmosphere

Highly recommended.

title: Outstanding
text:
Apart from Athens, this was the best archaeological museum we have visited thus far during our Greek holiday.

Excellently displayed, good descriptions. Very impressive.

title: Marvelous medieval site
text:
Really interesting Byzantine medieval fortified city on a hill overlooking the surrounding valley.

Do wear decent shoes, there's a lot of steep steps and rocky pathways.

Allow half a day for the complete site, upper and lower levels.

title: Stunning & Small
text:
Beautiful little cove with pebble beach. Small taverna nearby.

Crystal clear water.

Highly recommended.

title: Perfect setting
text:
Had a drink here and watched the beautiful azure blue sea.

Great setting next to a small pebble beach.

title: Picture perfect
text:
Beautiful settings beside a quintessential little Greek village.

Nearby bars and restaurants.

Recommended

title: Picture perfect
text:
Stunning location. Walking through the beautifully preserved old town, past inviting looking bars, restaurants and guesthouses and shops was very enjoyable.

Beautiful views everywhere, the sea, houses, the fort. Stop for a drink or lunch at one of the many venues with a view.

title: Great location
text:
If you are happy not to stay on the Kastro, this hotel is a great choice. A stone's throw from beach, with stunning views of the sea from the balcony.

Large clean room. Very friendly staff who most informative.

title: Great breakfast
text:
Thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast here. The beautifully ripe figs brought to us complimentary, were outstanding.

My Greek salad was excellent, as was the omelette.

Highly recommended.

title: Can't beat the location
text:
Location first class. Prices a little steep.

Greek salad extremely good, and I enjoyed the different slant on this Greek salad mainstay - capers brown bread croutons.

Grilled cheese & Turkey sandwich looked pretty unappetising, but was apparently good.

Wish that there'd been less use of single use plastic etc - nibbles in a plastic sealed pot, wine in a small one glass bottle.

Rather short change on the draft beer quantity - too much head, in spite of complaining.

title: Memorable
text:
This restaurant was highly rated on TripAdvisor, but initially I didn't fancy Italian whilst in Greece. However, having wandered by all the other restaurants, this one really appealed. We made the right choice.

Food was faultless, service excellent, atmosphere great, view to die for.

Can't recommend this restaurant more highly.

title: Perfect in all ways
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights and we were absolutely delighted with this accommodation.

Extremely clean, quiet, fantastic centrally located in the old Town.

Lovely room with large balcony to sit out on, which we used in the morning, early evenings and post dinner.

Fantastic to have the use of a small kitchen, where fresh ground coffee was supplied to make your own coffee, and little chocolate biscuits an added bonus with the coffee.

Can't recommend this accommodation more highly, it was perfect.

title: Truly stunning
text:
This was a highlight of our tour if the Peleponnese.

The theatre us do atmospheric and well preserved. Seating 12,000 people in its time! Really stunning and a definite must.

We arrived early and were fortunate that we almost had the place to ourselves.

title: Very good
text:
We had a lovely meal off the beaten tourist track, just ten minutes walk from old Town.

Waitress's English wasn't very good, and she seemed more interested in chatting to her friends. However she was attentive when we needed her.

Dishes were generous and very tasty. We had 5 starters between the two of us.

Recommended.

title: Shame and the graffiti
text:
Good views, worth a walk up to explore, but not too much else to see.

Rather spoiled by the amount of graffiti and litter.

title: Got better and better
text:
I was a bit sceptical at first. We started by exploring the highest area if the castle, left as you entered. Not too much left here, however things got more interesting as we progressed our visit

Great views, lots to see. Allow a good hour and wear decent footwear.

title: Authentic Greek restaurant
text:
Decided to eat outside of the Old Town and get away from the tourist restaurants.

We had an excellent meal, having a number of starters, rather than a starter and main course.

Most dishes were really excellent, although the meatmall starter would have benefited from a sauce.

Prices were extremely reasonable. Service was excellent and prompt.

Recommended.

title: Excellent, well presented
text:
In the grounds of Ancient Micyene, this is an excellent and very informative museum. Crammed packed with ancient pottery, artifacts, Jewellery, and other items.

Highly recommended

title: Interesting
text:
Visit here after visiting Ancient Micyene.

Really worthwhile stopping to look at this. Very picturesque.

title: Outstanding
text:
I remember studying Ancient Micyene at school, including the Lion Gate. To see it in person was such an amazing experience.

Visit in the afternoon when the sun will be on the gate.

title: A must
text:
Most people will be familiar with the image of The Lion Gate, and to actually see it and walk through it is something else. This is arguably the selling point of the site.

The museum was excellent and very informative.

Allow around two hours in total.

title: Best Greek salad EVER
text:
Stopped by for breakfast here, as they not only served breakfast, but a full menu on top. I was in the mood for a Greek salad, as I find it a nice refreshing start to the day.

Great Geek coffee.

My husband had the omelette, which he said was excellent. My Greek salad was simply the best I have ever had. Enough almost for two. Generous amount of feta, olives, finely sliced onion, cucumber, lovely brown bread croutons and green peppers.

Highly recommended.

title: Favourite beach
text:
Well worth a drive from Nafplio to spend a few hours at this delightful quiet beach.

Free sun loungers if we bought a drink, a bargain.

Very pretty beach.

Highly recommended.

title: Lovely
text:
Had a really delicious dinner here. Very friendly and professional service.

Very popular, we booked a table outside.

Highly recommended.

title: Surly waiters
text:
Never felt as unwelcome as we did at this smart looking restaurant.

No smiles, no helpful food advice, no conversation. No complimentary drink at the end of the meal (a first ever in Greece).

Food was pretty good, and generous portions.

I wouldn't return though.

title: Great omelette
text:
Sweet little café, inviting inside and very nicely decorated.

Excellent service. Omelette was delicious.

title: Lovely welcome breeze
text:
We stopped by for a drink as there was a most welcome breeze.

Good music, good wine, great atmosphere.

title: Stunning
text:
First and foremost, wear decent shoes, avoid sandals. The ground is very steep, rocky and slippery.

Secondly, the site closes at 3.30 pm, and you need to allow two hours to explore the fort.

Very very impressive and picturesque.

title: Incredibly impressive
text:
If you're in the area I highly recommend a quick view of this incredible engineering feat.

It won't take you long, but it's well worth the effort.

title: Perfectly located
text:
Stayed here for five nights and thoroughly enjoyed our time here.

Very large apartment overlooking the pool and the sea.

Very helpful and friendly staff who made us feel most welcome.

Five minute walk to the harbour and old Town.

Highly recommended.

title: Worth visiting
text:
If you are in Kos for a few days, it's definitely worth a visit.

We hired bicycles for the day, and cycled there and back from the town centre. It took an hour each way. Mostly flat, but one longish hill on the way there.

Therma pool varies in temperature, depending on where you sit in the pool, as see water enters the pool and cools the water down. The therma spring comes out of the rocks nearby, and flows into the natural pool. The water is very hot.

Little beach nearby to relax on

title: A tree!
text:
Blink and you'll miss it.

It's just a tree with scaffolding holding up some of the branches. Seen better trees in Kos town.

title: Amazing food
text:
We visited this restaurant twice during our five day stay in Kos. Wish I could come visit again and again.

Efficient, well trained staff, who were very knowledgeable about all the dishes.

Every dish was exquisite, and beautifully presented, and packed with amazing flavours.

House wine very good.

The best two meals I've had in Greece.

title: Great starters
text:
Are in the courtyard, under a much needed fan.

Service was prompt and helpful.

The starters were excellent, and my husband's lamb shank was absolutely delicious.

My grilled octopus wasn't great, too much balsamic glaze and the octopus itself wasnt as light as I'd hoped. I left half the octopus.

House wine excellent and good value for money.

Unfortunately my experience was completely marred when I was up in the night with vomiting and later with vomiting and diarrhoea. I think it must have been the octopus, and I'm just thankful I didn't eat it all. Perhaps,that's why I wasn't keen on the dish.

title: Terrible
text:
Please don't waste your money on this naff 'museum' and very underwhelming garden. Fake house full off one hundred year old tatty furniture.

No wonder this place wasn't in the guide book.

Nothing to recommended it, complete waste of time and money.

Avoid.

title: Stunning roof top dining room
text:
Had an excellent breakfast, and good Greek coffee.

My Greek salad was lovely, but there weren't any olives!

title: Impressive
text:
Visited during a day's use of a hire car.

Impressive ruins, covering a huge area.

Allow about an hour maximum.

8 Euros entrance fee.

title: Breathtaking views
text:
Hired a car for a couple of days, and this site was in our itinerary whilst exploring the west coast of the island.

A short walk up to the little 15th century castle and chapel. Extremely photogenic.

Wonderful views.

Definitely worth visiting.

title: Pretty
text: Do have a wander around this attractive square. Stop by the market and gave a coffee at one of the cafés.

title: Small
text:
Useful little market where you can buy small culinary gifts.

Aimed for the tourists, and not a place that the locals would shop at.

Worth a quick visit, but don't hold your breath!

title: Beautiful harbour
text: Certainly well worth a stroll along. Beautiful crystal blue waters, fine selection of impressive looking boats and yachts.

title: Fantastic experience
text:
A bit of a hike for us to get there, but gosh it was so worth it.

We arrived soon after 8 pm and had our pick of tables outside. The restaurant soon was very busy however, so we were pleased we arrived relatively early.

Service was prompt, helpful and extremely friendly.

All of our meze dishes were superb and very generous.

Will definitely return here for a faultless Greek experience.

title: Faultless
text:
Took the ferry from Rhodes to Nisyros.

Large new looking ferry. Spotlessly clean everywhere.

Punctual, helpful staff.

title: Fairly average
text: Perhaps I've been rather spoiled, but I wasn't particularly impressed. Not a desperate amount to see, but certainly worth a visit.

title: It's Closed
text:
The castle has been closed for three years, since an earthquake in 2017.

You can't really see much from the outside, and there is no information as to when the castle will reopen.

title: Lovely spot to people watch
text:
Had a quick drink here after visiting the beach.

Great bar to watch the boating activity.

Lovely wine and the draft beer was excellent.

title: Amazing
text:
Came here at the recommendation of our travel guide book, and we certainly weren't disappointed.

Very limited menu, but at least you know that everything will be fresh.

I had the shrimp with ozzo as a starter, and it was absolutely delicious and a generous portion.

My husband had a wonderful potato salad to start with, followed by a fillet steak and fries. Fries were fantastic and nice and hot and well salted. The steak, by weight, was cooked to perfection and delicious.

I had swordfish, first class and beautifully presented.

Do visit, it's a top notch restaurant.

title: Excellent breakfast
text:
Great location five minute walk from the ferry harbour.

Lovely views, nice breeze.

Greek coffee was excellent, as was the Greek salad.

My husband's Special Omelette looked delicious.

Highly recommended.

title: Well worth a visit
text:
We'd hired a car for a couple of days to explore the island, and Ancient Kamiros was one our list.

Hardly anyone else was there at around 10 am.

Allow about an hour to visit.

title: Fascinating
text:
We hired a car for the day in order that we could visit the volcano and other
attractions without constraints.

Recommend visiting before 11.00 am to avoid the tour buses. We were almost the sole people there.

Walked into the crater, fascinating sights and formations.

Highly recommended.

title: Great location
text:
Just a few minutes walk from the harbour, and 7 minutes walk to the nearby restaurants and cafes.

Clean basic rooms. Balcony which was lovely.

Hairdryer on request.

Not sure whether they offered breakfast, but we are out anyway.

title: Highly recommended
text:
Stayed here for 4 very happy nights. Perfect centrally located hotel, but also extremely quiet.

Large room, in fact we were given two interconnected rooms with two bathrooms.

Very clean, lovely little balcony.

Very helpful staff.

Would definitely stay again.

title: Tranquil beach
text:
Lovely quiet beach with sunlounger hire for 8 Euros. A small cafe and potable loo.

Worth a visit if passing by.

title: Idyllic setting
text:
Had breakfast here in a quiet lazy Sunday.

Stunning location by the sea, and a welcome breeze.

My Greek salad was delicious, as was the omelette.

Excellent coffee.

Highly recommended.

title: Beautiful
text:
Spotted this idyllic beach from the Acropolis.

Free parking just above the beach.

Deep blue water, a cafe, sun loungers, perfect for either a quick dip, or a few hours relaxation.

title: The Amalfi of Greece
text: Reminded my of the town of Amalfi in Italy. Lots of tourist shops, some inviting looking restaurants, great views and a lovely bay.

title: Expensive view
text:
Great views from the top. Not much really left of the original Acropolis, and the rebuilding looks rather too modern.

12 euro entrance fee.

A little underwhelming.

title: Marvelous
text:
Lovely quiet location away from the crowds.

Sat upstairs on the balcony. Great views.

Service was excellent.

We shared a few starters, including stuffed peppers with feta, which was outstanding.

My swordfish was delicious.

Only negative point was that the house wine wasn't very good and the wine by the bottle was quite expensive.

Highly recommended.

title: Good breakfast
text:
Stopped by for some breakfast en route to Lindos.

Great location overlooking the sea.

The Greek breakfast was excellent, as was the special omelet.

Very good coffee.

Recommended

title: Lovely & breezy
text:
Stopped by just for a drink. Off the beaten track and it had the benefit of being quiet and had a lovely cool breeze.

Prices reasonable.

title: Impressive
text:
Wandered around the lovely harbour during our first day. Beautiful sailing boats and pleasure cruisers.

Well kept and clean. Great views.

title: Very interesting
text:
Well worth a brief visit in conjunction with the palace.

Excellently displayed artifacts, statues, Jewellery and pottery.
place: Archaeological Museum of Rhodes (Hospital of the Knights)

title: A must
text:
We spent a thoroughly enjoyable hour or two visiting this superbly well kept palace.

Lovely and cool inside. Wonderful mosaics.
place: Palace of the Grand Master of the Knights of Rhodes

title: Great food, excellent value
text:
Had a marvelous dinner here in our arrival.

Very friendly proprietor, who suggested the mixed meze plater.

It was delicious, great variety of different dishes.

Wine great value.

Highly recommended.

title: Lovely hotel & restaurant
text:
Had a really excellent experience here. Lovely room, great service.

We are dinner in the restaurant, and the food was delicious. Ore dinner drinks outside overlooking the river.

The breakfast was first class.

Highly recommended and good value for money.

title: Great spring rolls
text:
Authentic Vietnamese food. Just popped in for some spring rolls. These are very nicely presented with dipping sauce and a small mound of salad. Four spring rolls, freshly made. Really excellent. Fast friendly service.

I would like to point out that Pho Nam no longer accept BYO wine with corkage.

title: Very budget
text: I really didn't enjoy my stay. The room was cold, stark and very uninviting. The room also smelled of cigarette smoke. Ate in the restaurant, and that was alright, fairly basic faire. Would not recommend.

title: Great Service
text: Took in a set of four large watercolours and a single watercolour to be framed. Decent choice of frames and mounts. I was absolutely delighted with the work, and customer care and communication. Highly recommended.

title: Fabulous
text: Everything from start to finish was exceptional. Lovely interior, warm and inviting. Friendly staff. Food excellent. Highly recommended.

title: Great food
text:
Very interesting quirky interior of this large pub, with lovely high ceilings.

Service was excellent. Good eccletic menu. Food was very good and very well presented.

title: Ideal
text:
Great location, decent price, basic room.

Stayed here on two occasions, at the beginning and end of our SE Asia trip. We were more than happy with hotel.

Great location. Allow one hour drive to or from main international airport.

Room clean, basic, but adequate.

Excellent buffet breakfast.

Ate one evening meal in their adjourning restaurant, food was good and they serve wine. Quite expensive though.

Didn't use or look at the pool as we were too busy.

title: A market to best all markets
text:
I know my markets, having travelled extensively. Not only is this market absolutely massive, I believe it beats the markets in Cairo, Istanbul, Jerusalem, Hanoi, Saignon, Hoi An, to name but a few, hands down.

Quality superb, variety endless, prices cheap. Antiques, carvings, leather, jewels, amazing clothes etc.

Spent 4 and a half very enjoyable hours there, and covered a lot of the good bits, but a fraction of the total market.

Forget the Christmas markets, go here.

title: Glorious smells and colours
text:
A sight to behold. Stunning array of exotic flowers. Expertly arranged and displayed.

Came upon the market by chance on our way to China Town. Well worth a quick visit.

title: Photogenic
text:
Wandered through this area on the way to China Town.

Some fabulous shops which look as though they haven't changed in decades. Fabulous spices, but sadly didn't buy.

title: Great fun
text: Walked through here and loved the place. Lots of great photo opportunities, but nothing worth buying.

title: Beautiful
text:
Thoroughly enjoyed our 2 hour visit. Incredibly photogenic area. Take a sarong if you need to cover up, and cover your arms (I took a vey lightweight cardigan which I took off after we finished).

Not too crowded, except Phra Buddha Deva Patimakorn temple where there was a 30 minute queue to enter, so we skipped seeing it.

title: Appauling
text:
Couldn't wait to leave this nasty place. Gives tourists a bad name.

Stalls full of over priced cheap naff tat. Horrid looking restaurants and bars, nothing going for the place at all.

title: Stunning
text:
Arrived at 0830 and the complex was pretty quiet. Lots to see, a lot of walking and climbing up step and uneven steps.

Didn't a couple of hours at this particular sight, but two days in total at the whole of Angkor Wat area.

title: Busy
text:
Visited this temple on our second day. After Angkor Wat, which is massive in comparison, Bayon was very crowded.

Beautiful bas relief carvings.

title: Relaxing quiet hotel
text:
We had a very pleasant stay at this charming and quiet hotel, away from the centre of town (a short $2 tut tut ride away). Very tasteful decor and beautiful landscaping.

Staff extremely friendly, polite and friendly.

Lovely pool area to relax after a hot and tiring day touring Angkor Wat.

Room very spacious, clean and quiet (apart from being woken up by the occupants in the room above us get up very early one morning).

Breakfast, an extra $5 was quite good. Excellent swift service.

Ate dinner at the restaurant once during our stay and the food was very good, although the table hadn't been properly set up and we weren't given proper napkins (which I later saw were on the other tables), and I had to ask for a candle which the other diners had. Can't stand using tiny bits I of tissue (looked like folded up loo paper!) which were provided for breakfast and which we had to make do with for dinner - as useful as a chocolate teapot.

Highly recommended.

title: Very pleasant
text:
It looked nice and it was. Nice comfy seating, not too noisy and decent prices.

We shared a starter - stuffed soft tortillas which were delicious.

My husband had the cheese burger, again very good, although the first attempt had to be returned as it was cold. A replacement came very quickly.

I had the spicey seafood soup with lemongrass and coconut with rice. More like a stew, and was excellent.

Good choice of wines. Ptices ok.

title: Fabulous small hotel
text:
Excellent central location.

Large tasteful and airy rooms. Friendly and very helpful staff.

The swimming pool was most welcome after a day's sight seeing in the heat and humidity.

The breakfast was really excellent, one of the best cooked to order breakfasts I have had on this month long trip. Always swiftly served.

We ate supper here on our first evening when we were to tired to look for restaurants elsewhere. I only realised they even served meals, other than breakfast, when I saw another resident order an evening meal. It wasn't made clear that the hotel offered this option, but I was very pleasantly surprised at how good the food was.

Lovely area under the ceiling fans to chill out in the evening with a beer and a good book.

Highly recommended.

title: Desperate but a must
text:
A grim but thought provoking visit.

30 minutes from the centre of Phnom Penh. Allow 2 hours for the audio visit.

title: Grim but a must
text:
The terrible deeds that took place less that forty years ago are illustrated here most graphically.

Essential to visit here to get a full understanding what this country has gone through.

We also owe the victims of this genocide the means to pass on this history to the world.

title: Underwelming
text: You don't need to allow too much time here. Probably far more impressive at night when lit up. Spent about 15 minutes here.

title: Open during Water Festival
text:
So pleased the Royal Palace was open during our stay which coincided with the Water Festival.

We took a chance and wandered over there at 0900 hrs (we were told it was closed by our hotel) and were delighted that it was open until noon.

We spent an hour and three quarters wandering around the compound, which wasn't very busy.

A few of the buildings were closed for renovation and the more impressive buildings now photography was allowed inside.

The most spectacular aspect of the complex was the mural depicting the classic Indian epic of the Ramayana (known as the Reamker in Cambodia). The story begins just south of the east gate and includes vivid images of the battle of Lanka. The mural was created around 1900 and parts of it have recently undergone restoration.

title: Best at night
text:
We walked past this statue during the day and at night.

It looks spectacular when lit up at night, whereas during the day it looks rather dreary.
place: Statue of King Father Norodom Sihanouk

title: Local Market
text: If you are after handicrafts, this is not the market for you. Mainly cheap watches, sunglasses and cheap poorly made clothing.

title: Have a cocktail in style
text:
We had to stop by for a cocktail and a snack whilst in Phnom Penh.

The epitomy of colonial style and grandeur, even if the rather intrusive 'background' music was a bit out of place.

Had to have a Singapore Sling - essence. Also had smoked salmon on blinis which were delicious.

If you want a splurge and have drink in a beautiful old style bar, I can't recommend The Elephant Bar in Raffles Hotel enough.
